slides.title: Welcome to SAP ERP
slides.content:
# Introduction to SAP ERP

SAP (Systems, Applications, and Products) is the world's leading **Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)** software, used by organizations worldwide to manage business operations.

## What You Will Learn

- **Overview of SAP and Modules** - Understanding the SAP landscape
- **SAP FICO Introduction** - Finance and Controlling modules
- **SAP Interface and Navigation** - Finding your way around
- **Master Data** - Customer, Vendor, and GL Account management

## Why SAP Matters

| Statistic | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Fortune 500 companies using SAP | 90%+ |
| Countries with SAP installations | 180+ |
| Active SAP users worldwide | 200+ million |
| Industries served | All major sectors |

## SAP in the Enterprise

```
+--------------------------------------------+
|             SAP ERP SYSTEM                 |
+--------------------------------------------+
|  Finance | HR | Sales | Production | MM   |
+--------------------------------------------+
|         Integrated Database               |
+--------------------------------------------+
```

> **SAP skills are valuable** - they open doors to global career opportunities!

slides.title: What is ERP?
slides.content:
# Understanding ERP Systems

## What is ERP?

Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) is **integrated software** that manages core business processes in real-time.

## The Problem ERP Solves

### Before ERP:
```
Finance System --> No Integration <-- Sales System
      |                                    |
      v                                    v
   Separate                            Separate
   Database                            Database
```

Problems:
- Data silos
- Duplicate entry
- Inconsistent information
- Delayed reporting

### With ERP:
```
+------------------------------------------+
|   Finance   |   Sales   |   Production   |
+------------------------------------------+
|         Single Integrated Database       |
+------------------------------------------+
```

Benefits:
- Single source of truth
- Real-time data
- Streamlined processes
- Better decision making

## Core ERP Functions

| Function | Purpose |
|----------|--------|
| Finance | Accounting, reporting, treasury |
| HR | Payroll, recruitment, training |
| Sales | Orders, pricing, customers |
| Procurement | Purchasing, vendors, inventory |
| Production | Planning, manufacturing |
| Logistics | Warehousing, shipping |

> **ERP integrates everything** for efficient operations!

slides.title: SAP History and Evolution
slides.content:
# SAP's Journey

## Company History

| Year | Milestone |
|------|----------|
| 1972 | Founded in Germany by 5 IBM engineers |
| 1979 | SAP R/2 released (mainframe) |
| 1992 | SAP R/3 released (client-server) |
| 2004 | SAP NetWeaver introduced |
| 2011 | SAP HANA in-memory database |
| 2015 | S/4HANA next-generation suite |
| 2020+ | Cloud-first strategy |

## SAP Product Evolution

### SAP R/3 (Legacy)
- Client-server architecture
- Traditional database
- Still used by many companies

### SAP ECC (Current for many)
- Enhanced version of R/3
- Additional functionality
- Widespread adoption

### S/4HANA (Future)
- Built on HANA database
- Simplified data model
- Real-time analytics
- Cloud and on-premise options

## SAP Product Portfolio

```
SAP Business Suite
    |
    +-- S/4HANA (ERP core)
    +-- SuccessFactors (HR)
    +-- Ariba (Procurement)
    +-- Concur (Travel/Expense)
    +-- Customer Experience
    +-- SAP Analytics Cloud
```

> **SAP continues to innovate** - stay current with the latest versions!

slides.title: SAP Modules Overview
slides.content:
# SAP Modules Explained

## Major SAP Modules

### Financial Modules

| Module | Full Name | Purpose |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| **FI** | Financial Accounting | External reporting, GL, A/P, A/R |
| **CO** | Controlling | Internal reporting, cost centers |
| **TR** | Treasury | Cash management, investments |

### Logistics Modules

| Module | Full Name | Purpose |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| **MM** | Materials Management | Procurement, inventory |
| **SD** | Sales and Distribution | Sales orders, billing |
| **PP** | Production Planning | Manufacturing |
| **WM** | Warehouse Management | Storage, picking |
| **QM** | Quality Management | Inspections, certificates |

### Human Resources

| Module | Full Name | Purpose |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| **HR/HCM** | Human Capital Management | Payroll, personnel |

### Technical Modules

| Module | Full Name | Purpose |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| **ABAP** | Programming Language | Customization, reports |
| **BASIS** | Administration | System configuration |

## Module Integration

```
       SD (Sales Order)
              |
              v
       MM (Delivery)  -->  FI (Invoice)
              |                  |
              v                  v
       PP (Production)     CO (Cost Analysis)
```

> **All modules work together** as an integrated system!

slides.title: SAP FICO Introduction
slides.content:
# SAP FICO Overview

## What is SAP FICO?

SAP FICO combines the **Financial Accounting (FI)** and **Controlling (CO)** modules, forming the financial backbone of SAP.

## FI Module Components

### General Ledger (GL)
- Chart of accounts
- Journal entries
- Financial statements

### Accounts Payable (AP)
- Vendor management
- Invoice processing
- Payment processing

### Accounts Receivable (AR)
- Customer management
- Billing
- Collections

### Asset Accounting (AA)
- Fixed assets
- Depreciation
- Asset lifecycle

### Bank Accounting
- Bank reconciliation
- Cash management

## CO Module Components

| Component | Purpose |
|-----------|--------|
| Cost Element Accounting | Define cost types |
| Cost Center Accounting | Track departmental costs |
| Internal Orders | Track project costs |
| Profit Center Accounting | Profitability by segment |
| Product Costing | Calculate product costs |

## FI vs CO

| Aspect | FI | CO |
|--------|-----|------|
| Focus | External | Internal |
| Users | Shareholders, auditors | Managers |
| Reports | Balance sheet, P&L | Cost reports |
| Legal | Mandatory | Optional |

> **FICO is one of the most in-demand SAP skills!**

slides.title: SAP System Landscape
slides.content:
# SAP System Architecture

## Three-Tier Architecture

```
+------------------+
| Presentation     |  <-- SAP GUI, Browser
+------------------+
         |
+------------------+
| Application      |  <-- SAP Application Server
+------------------+
         |
+------------------+
| Database         |  <-- Oracle, HANA, SQL Server
+------------------+
```

## System Landscape (DEV-QA-PROD)

### Development (DEV)
- Configuration and customization
- Custom program development
- Initial testing

### Quality Assurance (QA)
- Integration testing
- User acceptance testing
- Performance testing

### Production (PROD)
- Live business operations
- Real transactions
- Protected environment

## Transport System

```
DEV --> QA --> PROD
   ^       ^
   |       |
Transport Requests move changes
```

## Client Concept

Within each system, separate clients:

| Client | Purpose |
|--------|--------|
| 000 | SAP reference |
| 001 | Customer copy |
| 100+ | Custom clients |

Each client has **independent data** but shares code.

> **Understand the landscape** before making changes!

slides.title: SAP GUI Navigation
slides.content:
# SAP Interface and Navigation

## SAP GUI (Graphical User Interface)

The traditional way to access SAP:

```
+--------------------------------------------------+
| [Menu Bar]  [Standard Toolbar]  [Title Bar]     |
+--------------------------------------------------+
| Command Field: [________________]               |
+--------------------------------------------------+
|                                                  |
|     Application Screen Area                     |
|                                                  |
|                                                  |
+--------------------------------------------------+
| [Status Bar]                          [System]  |
+--------------------------------------------------+
```

## Key Navigation Elements

### Command Field (Transaction Code)
Direct access using transaction codes:

| Code | Function |
|------|----------|
| FB01 | Post document |
| FB03 | Display document |
| FS00 | GL account master |
| XK01 | Create vendor |
| XD01 | Create customer |

### Menu Path
Alternative navigation through menus:
```
Accounting > Financial Accounting > General Ledger
```

### Favorites
- Add frequently used transactions
- Organize in folders
- Right-click to add

## Useful Keyboard Shortcuts

| Shortcut | Action |
|----------|--------|
| Enter | Confirm entry |
| F3 | Back |
| F8 | Execute |
| Ctrl+S | Save |
| /n | New session |
| /nXXXX | New transaction |

> **Learn transaction codes** - they make you much faster!

slides.title: SAP Fiori Interface
slides.content:
# SAP Fiori - Modern Interface

## What is SAP Fiori?

SAP Fiori is a **modern, role-based user experience** that provides a consistent, personalized interface.

## Fiori vs Traditional GUI

| Aspect | SAP GUI | SAP Fiori |
|--------|---------|----------|
| Interface | Desktop application | Web browser |
| Design | Transaction-based | Role-based tiles |
| Device | PC only | Any device |
| Complexity | Full functionality | Simplified |
| Learning curve | Steep | Gentle |

## Fiori App Types

### Transactional Apps
- Create, change, delete data
- Similar to traditional transactions

### Analytical Apps
- Dashboards and reports
- Real-time insights
- Interactive charts

### Fact Sheets
- 360-degree view of objects
- Customer, vendor, material info

## Fiori Launchpad

```
+------------------------------------------+
| [Search] [Notifications] [Settings]      |
+------------------------------------------+
|                                          |
|  [Tile 1]  [Tile 2]  [Tile 3]  [Tile 4] |
|                                          |
|  [Tile 5]  [Tile 6]  [Tile 7]  [Tile 8] |
|                                          |
|        Role-Based Dashboard              |
+------------------------------------------+
```

Tiles show:
- Transaction shortcuts
- KPIs and counts
- Alerts and notifications

> **Fiori is the future** of SAP user experience!

slides.title: Understanding Master Data
slides.content:
# Master Data Concepts

## What is Master Data?

Master data is **core business data** that remains relatively constant and is used across multiple transactions.

## Characteristics of Master Data

| Characteristic | Description |
|----------------|-------------|
| **Persistence** | Stored long-term |
| **Centrality** | Used by multiple modules |
| **Stability** | Changes infrequently |
| **Consistency** | Single source of truth |

## Master Data vs Transaction Data

| Master Data | Transaction Data |
|-------------|------------------|
| Customer | Sales order |
| Vendor | Purchase order |
| Material | Goods receipt |
| GL Account | Journal entry |
| Cost Center | Cost allocation |
| Employee | Time entry |

## Key Master Data Objects

### Customer Master
- Who we sell to
- General, company code, sales data

### Vendor Master
- Who we buy from
- General, company code, purchasing data

### Material Master
- What we buy, make, sell
- Basic, purchasing, sales, accounting views

### GL Account Master
- Chart of accounts
- Account types and properties

### Cost Center Master
- Organizational units for cost tracking
- Hierarchy and responsibility

> **Clean master data** is essential for accurate transactions!

slides.title: Customer Master Data
slides.content:
# Customer Master in SAP

## Structure: Three Levels

### 1. General Data (Client Level)
- Name and address
- Communication details
- Tax information
- Valid across all company codes and sales areas

### 2. Company Code Data
- Account management information
- Payment terms
- Dunning (collection) procedures
- Reconciliation account

### 3. Sales Area Data
- Sales organization specific
- Distribution channel
- Division
- Pricing, shipping, billing settings

## Key Transaction Codes

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| XD01 | Create customer (all views) |
| XD02 | Change customer |
| XD03 | Display customer |
| VD01 | Create customer (sales) |
| FD01 | Create customer (FI) |

## Customer Account Groups

Define:
- Number range
- Field status (required/optional/hidden)
- Partner functions

| Group | Example |
|-------|--------|
| Sold-to | Order placement |
| Ship-to | Delivery address |
| Bill-to | Invoice recipient |
| Payer | Payment responsibility |

> **Complete customer data** enables smooth order processing!

slides.title: Vendor Master Data
slides.content:
# Vendor Master in SAP

## Structure: Three Levels

### 1. General Data (Client Level)
- Name and address
- Contact information
- Tax registration
- Control data

### 2. Company Code Data
- Payment terms
- Payment methods
- Correspondence settings
- Reconciliation account

### 3. Purchasing Organization Data
- Order currency
- Incoterms
- Purchasing conditions
- Partner roles

## Key Transaction Codes

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| XK01 | Create vendor (all views) |
| XK02 | Change vendor |
| XK03 | Display vendor |
| MK01 | Create vendor (purchasing) |
| FK01 | Create vendor (FI) |

## Vendor Account Groups

| Group | Example |
|-------|--------|
| Standard | Regular suppliers |
| One-time | Infrequent purchases |
| Intercompany | Affiliated companies |
| Contractor | Service providers |

## Important Fields

| Field | Purpose |
|-------|--------|
| Recon Account | Links to GL |
| Payment Terms | When to pay |
| Payment Method | How to pay |
| Order Currency | Transaction currency |

> **Accurate vendor data** ensures proper payments and relationships!

slides.title: GL Account Master Data
slides.content:
# General Ledger Accounts in SAP

## Two-Level Structure

### Chart of Accounts Level (COA)
- Account number
- Account name
- Account group
- P&L or Balance Sheet indicator

### Company Code Level
- Currency
- Tax category
- Reconciliation account type
- Field status group

## Key Transaction Codes

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| FS00 | GL account centrally |
| FSP0 | GL in chart of accounts |
| FSS0 | GL in company code |
| FS10N | GL account balance display |

## Account Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| **Balance Sheet** | Assets, liabilities, equity |
| **P&L** | Revenue, expenses |
| **Primary Cost** | Costs from FI |
| **Secondary Cost** | Internal allocations |

## Reconciliation Accounts

Special GL accounts linked to subledgers:

| Subledger | Recon Account |
|-----------|---------------|
| Customer (AR) | Trade receivables |
| Vendor (AP) | Trade payables |
| Asset | Fixed assets |

## Chart of Accounts

```
COA: CAUS (US Chart)
  |
  +-- 1xxxxx Assets
  +-- 2xxxxx Liabilities
  +-- 3xxxxx Equity
  +-- 4xxxxx Revenue
  +-- 5xxxxx Expenses
```

> **Well-organized GL accounts** are foundation of good reporting!

slides.title: Organizational Structure
slides.content:
# SAP Organizational Structure

## Enterprise Structure Hierarchy

```
Client (000, 100, etc.)
    |
    +-- Company Code (1000, 2000)
    |       |
    |       +-- Business Area
    |       +-- Plant
    |       +-- Purchasing Org
    |
    +-- Controlling Area
            |
            +-- Cost Centers
            +-- Profit Centers
```

## Key Organizational Units

### Client
- Highest level
- Represents the entire enterprise
- Master data can be client-level

### Company Code
- Legal entity
- Independent balance sheet
- Required for FI transactions

### Business Area
- Optional segment reporting
- Across company codes

### Plant
- Manufacturing/distribution location
- Inventory management

### Controlling Area
- Internal reporting unit
- Can span company codes

## FI vs CO Organization

| FI Structure | CO Structure |
|--------------|---------------|
| Company Code | Controlling Area |
| Business Area | Cost Center |
| Segment | Profit Center |

## Assignment Relationship

```
Controlling Area --> Company Code(s)
     |
     +-- Operating Concern
```

> **Understand the structure** before configuring SAP!

slides.title: SAP Document Concept
slides.content:
# Document Principle in SAP

## What is a Document?

Every transaction in SAP creates a **document** - a complete, auditable record of the business event.

## Document Types

### FI Documents
| Type | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| SA | GL posting |
| KR | Vendor invoice |
| KZ | Vendor payment |
| DR | Customer invoice |
| DZ | Customer payment |

### MM Documents
| Type | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| GR | Goods receipt |
| GI | Goods issue |
| PO | Purchase order |

### SD Documents
| Type | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| SO | Sales order |
| DN | Delivery |
| BI | Billing |

## Document Number

```
Document Number: 1000000001
Company Code: 1000
Fiscal Year: 2024

Unique Key: 1000000001 / 1000 / 2024
```

## Document Structure

```
+------------------------+
| Document Header        |
| - Date, Doc Type       |
| - Reference, Text      |
+------------------------+
| Line Item 1           |
| - Account, Amount     |
+------------------------+
| Line Item 2           |
| - Account, Amount     |
+------------------------+
| (Debits = Credits)    |
+------------------------+
```

> **Every business event leaves a document trail!**

slides.title: SAP Reporting Basics
slides.content:
# Reporting in SAP

## Types of Reports

### Standard Reports
Pre-built SAP reports:

| TCode | Report |
|-------|--------|
| FS10N | GL account balance |
| FBL1N | Vendor line items |
| FBL5N | Customer line items |
| S_ALR_87012293 | Financial statements |

### Custom Reports
- Created using ABAP
- Query tools (SAP Query, QuickViewer)
- Report Painter/Writer

### ALV Reports
SAP List Viewer features:
- Sorting and filtering
- Column selection
- Export to Excel
- Layout saving

## Report Navigation

### Drill-Down
Click totals to see details:
```
Total Revenue --> By Customer --> By Invoice
```

### Report Variants
Save selection criteria:
- Date ranges
- Company codes
- Filters

## Common Report Paths

### Financial Reports
```
Accounting > Financial Accounting > 
    General Ledger > Information System
```

### Controlling Reports
```
Accounting > Controlling > 
    Cost Center Accounting > Information System
```

> **Learn standard reports** before creating custom ones!
